stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on building Course 14, a craft-themed "cardboard & glue" world, while debugging a crash and watching N64 performance. Much of the stream is visual-design iteration: textures, skybox, death-floor, and novel shader tricks. He also chats about YouTube strategy and demo status.

development_findings.summary: A recent code optimisation (suggested by chat) introduced a crash; Kaze located the faulty function and rolled the change back.
development_findings.quote: I will undo this optimisation from chat.

development_findings.summary: FPS analysis shows Course 1 got slower; Kaze tracks per-task timings (Ren, Game Loop, Idle) to isolate regressions.
development_findings.quote: Ren went to 5.2 ms and Game Loop is half a second more… doesn’t make much sense to me.

development_findings.summary: Course 14’s core concept is a giant craft diorama made of cardboard, glue, tape, scissors, yarn, etc., placed on a ‘table’ with a death floor.
He rejected a ‘table/desk’ floor because players would assume it’s walkable; instead he plans a vertical paper cylinder with painted scenery and hidden death floor.
development_findings.quote: If I do that, it looks like you can go to the bottom and I want there to be a death floor.

development_findings.summary: Implemented a rim-lighting trick (‘fake normal map’) to make painted backgrounds glisten without heavy cost, tuning via assembly.
development_findings.quote: Shall I add a fake normal map to this so that when you turn the camera there are highlights? Oh, that would look so good.

development_findings.summary: Designed glue surfaces that dampen Mario’s jumps, and enemy ideas: moving scissors, tape that slows, glue balls you stick to.
Decided Course 14 will have no boss; Course 15 assets are already half done from earlier slide-deck work.
Background objects will render in an infinite PG without Z-buffer to save fill-rate; overdraw reduction and collision-node pruning are ongoing concerns.
Demo release is blocked on Course 1 remake and further performance work; Biobak owns the remake.
development_findings.quote: Biobak is currently still working on the Course 1 remake. I want that to be in the demo.

context_findings.summary: Kaze has three days of vacation left before returning to his day job, balancing work and hobby.
context_findings.quote: I just have three more days of vacation and then it’s back to work.

context_findings.summary: He hired an external video editor; YouTube is the ‘job part’, game dev is the ‘fun part’.
context_findings.quote: Yes, I have an editor now. This is the job part and making the game is the fun part.

context_findings.summary: Excited that latest video outperforms previous uploads (~80 % more views) and could hit one million.
context_findings.quote: This might be a 1 million view banger.

context_findings.summary: Cautious about technical videos until he fully grasps N64 RSP; defers ‘everyone was wrong about the N64’ piece.
context_findings.quote: I’m not entirely comfortable making this video yet… there’s so much RSP stuff I don’t understand.

context_findings.summary: Avoids Nintendo Giga-Leak material to reduce takedown risk; plans to re-release ‘Missing Link’ despite prior DMCA.
context_findings.quote: If I ever look at the Giga Leak… they’re gonna completely murder me.

biobak.summary: Remaking Course 1 for the public demo; also suggested enclosing Course 14 inside a paper cylinder with drawn scenery.
biobak.quote: Biobak was suggesting that this whole thing would be inside a paper cylinder and the paper cylinder is gonna have stuff drawn onto it.

key_stories.title: Optimization Gone Wrong
key_stories.summary: Chat proposed an optimisation that Kaze merged off-stream, only to have the game crash at start-up. On stream he pinpointed the offending function and reverted the change, scrapping a video he had already recorded about the tweak.
key_stories.challenge: New optimisation introduced a hard crash.
key_stories.process: Profiled, compared commits, inspected large function for null pointer, confirmed bad array access, rolled back code.
key_stories.outcome: Crash fixed; video deleted; lesson on trusting chat code.
key_stories.key_quote: Well, I guess I have to fix that… I will undo this optimisation from chat.

key_stories.title: How to Kill a Death Floor
key_stories.summary: Designing Course 14’s scenery, Kaze realised that placing the diorama on a desk invites players to jump down. He brainstormed alternatives, finally choosing a tall paper cylinder with taped seam and mountains to mask edges.
key_stories.challenge: Need visual context that explains instant death without feeling unfair.
key_stories.process: Evaluated desk, shoebox, terrarium; tested textures; consulted chat and Biobak; prototyped wrapping-paper water and cardboard mountains.
key_stories.outcome: Committed to paper-cylinder backdrop plus hidden death floor; background texture and rim-lighting shader prototyped.
key_stories.key_quote: Maybe we need to innovate a different way to make a death floor look.

open_questions.context: Kaze says Mario will ‘get stuck’ and lose jump height on glue, but implementation details were not shown.
